node.title: Steven Spielberg could get snubbed.
node.alt: Steven Spielberg, whose “West Side Story” may be in contention.
node.description: By Brooks Barnes and Nicole Sperling
node.content: ["A Hollywood changing of the guard? The best director category could shape up as Exhibit A.", "Only seven women have ever been nominated for best director, and only two have won, including the reigning victor, Chlo\u00e9 Zhao (\u201cNomadland\u201d). Jane Campion, who directed the slow-burn \u201cPower of the Dog\u201d for Netflix, is widely expected to become the only woman nominated twice \u2014 and she is the runaway favorite to win, to boot. (Campion was previously nominated for \u201cThe Piano\u201d in 1994.)", "Kenneth Branagh, Paul Thomas Anderson and Denis Villeneuve (\u201cDune\u201d) are also expected to receive nods. It would be Branagh\u2019s second directing nomination, Anderson\u2019s third and Villeneuve\u2019s second.", "That leaves Hollywood\u2019s great elder statesman, Steven Spielberg, as the underdog. Some awards columnists, including our own Projectionist, think he may be snubbed altogether. The Japanese director Ryusuke Hamaguchi could nab the fifth slot for his critically beloved \u201cDrive My Car.\u201d", "Such an outcome would signal \u2014 in skywriting \u2014 that the academy is pointed toward fresh cinematic voices. In recent years, the organization has dramatically expanded its overseas membership to make itself less of a club for white men."]
